titleStmt.title: Atlas maritimus. or A book of charts Describeing the sea coasts capes headlands sands shoals rocks and dangers the bayes roads harbors rivers and ports, in most of the knowne parts of the world. With the true courses and distances, from one place to another. Gathered from the latest and best discoveryes, that have bin made by divers able and experienced navigators of our English nation. Accomodated with an hydrographicall description of the whole world. By John Seller. Hidrographer to ye Kings most excellent Majestie.
titleStmt.author: Seller, John, fl. 1658-1698.

publicationStmt.publisher: And are to be sold by him, at the Hermitage Staires in Wapping and at his shop in the Exchange Alley near the Royall Exchange in London,

notesStmt.note: Title page is engraved and is counted with the plates.
First publication, with 26 maps, under title: Atlas maritimus, or, A book of charts. [London, 1670?] but all copies and editions vary in contents. Cf. Phillips.
The maps are on 39 double plates.
Reproduction of original in the John Carter Brown Library.

place.placeName: his shop in the Exchange Alley near the Royall Exchange in London
